thread.title: Brown, Earl, Poles to join Hall of Fame
thread.title_full: Brown, Earl, Poles to join Hall of Fame

author: Phil Anastasia
title: Brown, Earl, Poles to join Hall of Fame
text:
Brown, Earl, Poles to join Hall of Fame Updated: January 2, 2017 â€” 11:21 AM EST 454 Share Phil Anastasia Staff Writer 
Phil Anastasia is an award-winning sports columnist for The Inquirer. His work has been cited by the Associated Press Sports Editors and the New Jersey Press Association, and his 2011 column on the tragedy at Mainland Regional High School won first place in the New Jersey Chapter of the Society of Professional Journalists. 
Anastasia has written sports in the Philadelphia area since 1980, serving as a Philadelphia Eagles beat writer as well as a sports columnist and sports editor at the Courier-Post in Cherry Hill, N.J. before joining The Inquirer. More by Phil Anastasia Arrow icon 

Former Camden High School star Denny Brown, who won two state titles with the Panthers and played for a team that was ranked No. 1 in the nation, is among the new inductees to the South Jersey basketball Hall of Fame by the Carino Club. 
Brown as well as Denny Earl, Demetrius Poles, Dan Merrifield, Pat Murphy, Frank Henry, Megan Light Mason and Faye Gerald will be inducted at the club's annual Hall of Fame event Feb. 12 at the Crowne Plaza in Cherry Hill. 
Brown graduated from Camden in 1988. He started for teams that won Group 4 state titles in 1986 and 1987 and finished second in the state in 1988. 
Camden's undefeated 1986 team was No. 1 in the nation according to USA Today. Brown finished his career with 1,608 points and later played for Iona and Coppin State. 
Other members of the class of 2017: 
-- Denny Earl, Riverside class of 1962. He was a star player at Riverside and played at Rutgers. He was active in youth sports for years in South Jersey. His sons Danny and Brian won state titles at Shawnee and now are college head coaches -- Danny at VMI and Brian at Cornell. 
-- Faye Gerald, Pleasantville class of 1981. She scored 1,875 points and led Pleasantville to two state titles. She played at St. John's. 
-- Frank Henry, long-time official who worked numerous big games in South Jersey as well as Philadelphia high school and college basketball. 
-- Megan Light Mason, Gloucester class of 1998. She scored 2,443 points for Gloucester and was a four-time All-South Jersey selection. She played at Fairfield and scored 1,169 for the Stags. 
-- Dan Merrifield, Mainland class of 1981. He scored 1,646 points at Mainland and played at Virginia on teams that featured Ralph Sampson. 
-- Pat Murphy, Gloucester Catholic class of 1977. He won 327 games as a coach during two stints at his alma mater. He is Gloucester Catholic's athletic director. 
-- Demetrius Poles, Delsea class of 1991. He led Delsea to the Group 2 state title as a senior and scored 1,783 career points. He started for Rowan's 1996 NCAA Division III national title team and played and coached overseas for more than 10 years. 
For more information about the event as well as ticket information, contact Jack Mongulla at 856-461-8800 or Bill Hiltner at 609-820-1169. 
-- Contact Phil Anastasia at panastasia@phillynews.com
